DOCNAME: TANEVA & OTHERS v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON ( “ the first applicant ” ) , Mr PERSON ( “ the second applicant ” ) and Mr PERSON ( “ the third applicant ” ) , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They were represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE and DATE respectively , the then ORG of GPE ( Народен Одбор на PERSON ) confiscated CARDINAL adjacent plots of land ( former CARDINAL . CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ORG ) and CARDINAL ( CARDINAL m² ) from members of the applicants’ families .

On DATE ORG allocated several plots of land ( with different numbering ) , covering an area of CARDINAL m² , to a construction company , PERSON , for the construction of a residential building . That decision became final on DATE . The second and third applicants stated that the decision had not concerned plot no . CARDINAL . According to the amended urban development plan of DATE , a larger residential and business complex was intended to be constructed on that land .

By court decisions of DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively , it was established that the applicants had inherited a restitution claim ( наследник на правото на денационализација ) in respect of a property confiscated from the members of their families , and that the property included the plots at issue .

On DATE ORG ( “ the Ministry ” ) amended the decision of ORG of DATE , allocating several plots of land ( with different numbering from those indicated in the latter decision , with CARDINAL exception ) , the total surface area of which was CARDINAL m² , to the LOC company for the construction of the residential and business complex as specified in the urban development plan of DATE . According to the second and third applicants , CARDINAL m² of plot no . CARDINAL was affected by this decision .
On DATE the first applicant submitted a request before ORG for restitution of plot no . CARDINAL , which was allegedly still undeveloped given that there were only temporary portakabins at the site .

On DATE ORG of ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) dismissed the request as ill - founded . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) upheld an appeal submitted by the first applicant and annulled that decision . It found that ORG had incompletely established the facts as to whether plot no . CARDINAL had been undeveloped .
No further decision has been given in these proceedings .
On DATE the second and third applicants submitted a request to ORG for restitution of plot no . CARDINAL , which according to them was still undeveloped .

On DATE ORG dismissed this request , finding that the second and third applicants had already received compensation for the land in CARDINAL forms : CARDINAL m² had been restored to them and pecuniary compensation had been paid for the remainder . Referring to an on - site examination of DATE , it found that there had been a construction site of CARDINAL m² on the relevant land which had been allocated , pursuant to the LOC decisions of DATE and DATE , to the M. company for the construction of the residential and business complex , as specified in the urban development plan of DATE .

On DATE the second and third applicants appealed , arguing that , inter alia , CARDINAL m² of the land had been undeveloped on DATE , the date of the submission of their restitution claims , and should have been restored to them accordingly ; that ORG should have applied section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) ; that the on - site examination had not been carried out in good time ; and that the temporary portakabins had been dismantled on DATE , when the PERSON company had started construction works without any valid documentation .

On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal , under section CARDINAL of LAW , stating that the second and third applicants had already received compensation and the purpose of the confiscation had been achieved .

On DATE the second and third applicants lodged with ORG an appeal on points of law ( тужба за управен спор ) , claiming that CARDINAL m² of the relevant land had still been undeveloped on the relevant date and should have been restored to them accordingly . They further agreed to return the compensation which they had already received for part of the land .

On DATE ORG , relying on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , upheld the dismissal of the second and third applicants’ claims for restitution of the relevant land . It further held that the land could not be regarded as undeveloped , given the ongoing construction works in accordance with the urban development plan . In this latter connection , the court referred to a construction contract of CARDINAL DATE concluded between the M. company and ORG , according to which the ORG ’s administrative offices had been located on the land in question . The fact that the restitution claim had been submitted when those offices had been demolished and the construction site had been in preparation did not mean that the land at issue had been undeveloped .
On DATE the public prosecutor informed the second and third applicants that there were no grounds for lodging a request with ORG for the protection of legality .

On DATE the first applicant appealed against the ORG ’s decision of DATE . It appears that the second and third applicants appealed against that decision as well . No evidence was provided in this latter connection .
On DATE the ORG requested ORG , as a supervisory body , to annul the ORG ’s decision as contrary to section CARDINAL of LAW .

On DATE ORG , acting of its own motion and exercising its supervisory powers ( по службена должност , а по право на надзор ) , annulled the ORG ’s decision . Referring to the ORG appeals , ORG found the impugned decision contrary to section CARDINAL of LAW .
On an unspecified date in DATE , the Attorney - General and the LOC company challenged ORG decision before ORG . No copy of these appeals was communicated to the applicants .

On DATE ORG annulled the decision of DATE , finding , inter alia , that ORG had wrongly regarded the ORG ’s decision as a legal measure or a unilateral declaration within the meaning of section CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) . It further found that the land indicated in the ORG ’s decision could not have been regarded as undeveloped for the reasons stated above ( in its decision of CARDINAL DATE ) . In addition , it referred to the construction , under the contract of CARDINAL DATE ( see above ) , of another administrative building which had accommodated civil servants from the provisional administrative offices that had previously been located on the relevant land . The applicants unsuccessfully requested the public prosecutor to institute legality review proceedings before ORG . Their requests for the reopening of the proceedings have still not been determined .
On DATE ORG dismissed the first applicant ’s appeal and upheld the ORG ’s decision of DATE .

On DATE ORG allowed an appeal on points of law by the applicants and annulled ORG decision . It ruled that the applicants’ claims for restitution should have been decided as a preliminary question ( претходно прашање ) before the land was allocated for construction . It therefore instructed the Ministry to suspend ( прекинување ) the proceedings pending the outcome of the restitution proceedings .
No further decision has been given in the course of these proceedings .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW provides that confiscated property for which compensation has been paid can not be the subject of restitution . Under subsection CARDINAL , in exceptional cases , property for which compensation has been paid can be restored . The claimant is obliged to return the compensation received , in an amount and according to a procedure regulated by a Government decree .

Section CARDINAL ) of LAW provides that ownership of building land is to be restored where the purpose of confiscation has not been achieved , as well as when that purpose has been achieved and the land , at the time of submission of the restitution claim , was undeveloped .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) provides that property that is the subject of restitution can not be disposed of after the entry into force of LAW Legal measures and unilateral declarations taken contrary to subsection CARDINAL are null and void .

Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( “ the LAW ” ) , as valid at the material time , an administrative body was obliged to give a decision and serve it on the party concerned within DATE after the submission of a request . A party whose request had not been decided within that time - limit could lodge an appeal in the same way as if the request had been dismissed .

Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , if an appeal had been submitted in the absence of a decision at first instance , the second - instance body would set a time - limit , of DATE , within which the first - instance body should give a decision . In the event of non - compliance , the second - instance body could decide the matter by itself .
LAW of DATE ( “ the DATE LAW ) , which replaced LAW , provides for the same rules as LAW , as indicated above ( sections CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ) .

Section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE ( “ the DATE LAW ) , provided that a third party directly affected by the annulment of an impugned administrative decision ( interested party ) was to be treated as a party to the proceedings .

Under section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of the LAW , if the second - instance body did not give a decision within DATE , an interested party could lodge an appeal on points of law with ORG in the same way as if his or her appeal had been dismissed .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provided that an interested party could ask the second - instance body to decide on his or her request if the first - instance body had failed to issue a decision within DATE from the submission of that request . If the second - instance body failed to give a decision , the interested party could lodge an appeal on points of law under the conditions specified in subsection CARDINAL .
LAW of DATE , which replaced LAW , provides for the same rules as those laid down in section CARDINAL of the DATE LAW ) .
Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , developed building land is land on which a structure of a permanent nature has been built in accordance with the law .

Several individuals from GPE sought restitution of part of a plot of land which was allegedly still undeveloped and , under the relevant urban development plan , was set aside for the construction of a residential building . Their claim was dismissed at first and second instance since they had received compensation for the confiscated property . In a decision of DATE ORG annulled the second - instance decision so that the facts could be established with a view to applying section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( U.br.CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

In a final decision of DATE ORG accepted the first applicant ’s request and restored to her possession a different plot of undeveloped land in GPE . She was also ordered to return the compensation which had been paid to her predecessor ( Дн.бр.CARDINAL - CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( DATE ) ) .
